xxl.core.math.statistics.nonparametric.aggregates
Class RKDEAggregateFunction

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.math.functions.AggregationFunction<java.util.List,ReflectionKernelDensityEstimator>
      xxl.core.math.statistics.nonparametric.aggregates.RKDEAggregateFunction
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, OnlineAggregation
public class RKDEAggregateFunction
extends AggregationFunction<java.util.List,ReflectionKernelDensityEstimator>
implements OnlineAggregation

In the context of online aggregation, running aggregates are built. Given an iterator of data, an Aggregator computes iteratively aggregates. For instance, the current maximum of the already processed data is determined. An internal aggregation function processes the computation of the new element by consuming the old aggregate and the new element from the input cursor. Generally, each aggregation function must support a function call of the following type:
agg_n = f (agg_n-1, next).
There, agg_n denotes the computed aggregation value after n steps, f represents the aggregation function, agg_n-1 the computed aggregation value after n-1 steps and next the next object to use for computation.
This class implements an aggregation function that computes the reflection kernel density estimator. Given an old and a new sample as processed objects, this function computes the reflection kernel density estimator based on the new sample.
Consider the following example that displays a concrete application of a reflection kernel density estimator aggregation function combined with an aggregator: 

        Aggregator aggregator =
                new Aggregator(
                        new Aggregator( input, mapSamplingStrategy (sampleSize, samplingType)),
                        new ReflectionKernelDensityEstimatorAggregateFunction()
                );

See Also:
Aggregator, AdaptiveAggregationFunction, Aggregators, ReflectionKernelDensityEstimator, Serialized Form

Method Detail

invoke

public ReflectionKernelDensityEstimator invoke(ReflectionKernelDensityEstimator old,
                                               java.util.List next)
Two-figured function call for supporting aggregation by this function. Each aggregation function must support a function call like agg_n = f (agg_n-1, next), where agg_n denotes the computed aggregation value after n steps, f the aggregation function, agg_n-1 the computed aggregation value after n-1 steps and next the next object to use for computation. This method delivers only null as aggregation result as long as the aggregation has not yet initialized.

Specified by:
invoke in class AggregationFunction<java.util.List,ReflectionKernelDensityEstimator>
Parameters:
old - result of the aggregation function in the previous computation step
next - next object used for computation
Returns:
aggregation value after n steps, i.e., a reflection kernel density estimator

getState

public java.lang.Object getState()
Returns the current status of the on-line aggregation function implementing the OnlineAggregation interface.

getState in interface OnlineAggregation
Returns:
the current state of this function

public void setState(java.lang.Object status)
Sets a new status of the on-line aggregation function implementing the OnlineAgggregation interface (optional). This method is not supported by this class. It is implemented by throwing an UnsupportedOperationException.

Specified by:
setState in interface OnlineAggregation
Parameters:
status - current state of the function
Throws:
